subject: Relationships
title: The Peak-End Rule in Dating
description: A quick, practical guide to The Peak-End Rule in Dating.

hook.text: A three-hour date with one magical moment is remembered better than a perfect date with no standout peak.

buildup.text: The peak-end rule says we judge experiences by their most intense moment and how they end.

discovery.text: A mediocre dinner followed by an unexpected rooftop kiss will be remembered as an amazing date.

twist.text: This also means a great date ruined by an awkward goodbye is remembered as a bad one overall.

climax.text: Memory doesn't average your experiences. It snapshots the peak and the ending â€” and discards the rest.

punchline.text: One great moment matters more than two okay hours.

quiz.question: What does the peak-end rule say about how we remember dates?
options: We judge by the peak moment and the ending
